channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft -- Windows 10
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft -- Windows 10

item.title: CVE-2024-6769|2024-10-02T17:12:48.256Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010
item.description: A DLL Hijacking caused by drive remapping combined with a poisoning of the activation cache in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated attacker to elevate from a medium integrity process to a high integrity process without the intervention of a UAC prompt.

item.title: CVE-2024-6768|2024-08-13T14:24:58.377Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010
item.description: A Denial of Service in CLFS.sys in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated low-privilege user to cause a Blue Screen of Death via a forced call to the KeBugCheckEx function.

item.title: CVE-2024-6768|2024-08-12T18:29:30.770Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010
item.description: A Denial of Service in CLFS.sys in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated low-privilege user to cause a Blue Screen of Death via a forced call to the KeBugCheckEx function.

item.title: CVE-2024-6769|2024-09-26T20:18:38.460Z -- microsoft -- windows%2010
item.description: A DLL Hijacking caused by drive remapping combined with a poisoning of the activation cache in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated attacker to elevate from a medium integrity process to a high integrity process without the intervention of a UAC prompt.
